intro: Conopodium denudatum var. vaginatum, commonly known as the naked bladderpod, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and alternate leaves that are often reduced to small, scale-like structures. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in racemes. The fruit is a dry, dehiscent pod that releases seeds when mature, contributing to its reproductive strategy.
